item.title: Why Teamsters won't endorse a candidate for 2024. And, how to avoid credit card debt.
item.description: The Teamsters, a large and prominent union, is not endorsing a presidential candidate this cycle, breaking away from what other labor unions are doing. And, tips on how to avoid credit card debt.

item.title: COMIC: Can I just wash the stinky bits? And other honest questions about bathing
item.description: Washing your body seems like a no-brainer. But once you get into the details, things get complicated. Dermatologists offer surprising advice on how often to shower, when to toss your loofah and more.

item.title: Concerns about noncitizen voting drive sweeping new restrictions in New Hampshire
item.description: A new law in New Hampshire will require anyone registering to vote for the first time in the Granite State to provide documentation they are U.S. citizens, like a birth certificate or passport.

item.title: Exclusive: Watchdog finds Black girls face more frequent, severe discipline in school
item.description: The Government Accountability Office found that Black girls received nearly half of the most severe punishments, like expulsion, even though they represent only 15% of girls in public schools.

item.title: Sickle cell gene therapies roll out slowly
item.description: It’s been almost a year since the Food and Drug Administration approved the first genetic treatments for sickle cell disease. So far, only a few patients have received the long-awaited treatments.
